header: I've assembled a 25-second cinematic montage across 43 segments. The goal was a high-impact edit, but I had to fight against a library that's running on empty.

advisor.hero: The library is starving for energy; I had to fake the intensity because the shots just weren't there.
advisor.body: We are missing wide shots and payoff moments. This forced me into an aggressive pacing style to hide the fact that the footage lacks scale and emotional resolution.

friction_log: Started with high confidence in the sync, but immediately hit a wall with the lack of wide shots.
Middle of the edit became a struggle to maintain momentum without any real payoff shots to land on.
Ended by leaning heavily on aggressive pacing to mask the fact that we're recycling the same low-energy motifs.

post_mortem.worked: The tight sync and teal-orange filmic grade successfully unified a very fragmented set of clips.
post_mortem.didnt: The edit feels claustrophobic because there are zero wide shots to establish scale, and the 'payoff' moments feel unearned.

next_steps: Capture wide shots to provide visual relief and scale.
Record high-energy payoff footage to give the aggressive pacing a destination.
Source specific 'joy' and 'intensity' motifs to replace the structural placeholders.
technical: Applied a relentless pacing strategy to compensate for the scarcity of high-energy footage.
Used a teal-orange filmic LUT to create visual consistency across disparate clip sources.
Maintained nominal sync fidelity to ensure the edit felt intentional despite the library gaps.
